page.title: 06Farming
page.content: In Milburn there are 10 farms only 6 farms responded to our survey. The information relates to these 6. 4 farms are owned by the farmer 2 are rented. The farms are mainly beef and sheep with 2 dairy farms.There are 3,201 sheep and 911 cattle. The average acreage of the farms is 285 acres (115 hectares ) 3 farms employ 2 men 1 employs 1 and 2 do not employ anyone.Winter and spring barley turnips swedes silage and hay are grown for fodder. Some potatoes are grown on rotation. Milburn village is 188 feet above sea level rising to 800 feet plus this high land is moorland and is used for sheep grazing. Twice a year there is a sheep gathering into pens and sorted out for clipping and dipping. Because of the nature of the land it is most suited to grazing rather than arable crops.
